definition:
I/O (Input/Output) ports are the registers that a cpu uses to communicate with external hardware such as displays, keyboards, other processors etc.
MMIO (Memory Mapped I/O) is I/O ports that are built into the address space of the data memory (RAM) so are accessed in the same way as data.
PMIO (Port Mapped I/O) is separate I/O ports that do not share the same address space of the data memory, but are instead accessed using a completely different instruction(s)
